text: what are my favorite parts of a veggie
burger one it has to be delicious and
full of nutritious ingredients and two
it has to stay together then this quinoa
feta burger fulfills all those
requirements start by mashing one
15-ounce can kidney beans you could use
really any sort of bean that you want
this is going to give us the structure
for our burger I've just rinsed these
she's a regular old masher so addition
to lending structure and support this is
going to give a lot of fiber added
protein make it a really nice hearty
veggie burger so mash this into a paste
it can be a pretty coarse paste now more
structure we're going to add eggs two
eggs to this and you want to just gently
whisk them before they go in that will
help keep all the ingredients nice and
incorporated and we go to that add three
cups of cooked quinoa start with about a
cup uncooked that should get you to the
three cup mark and this is nice and
cooled as well so quinoa is really
hearty complete protein contains all the
essential amino acids that your body
needs to repair tissues make you feel
full energized so I'm going to just
start mixing this together now to all of
our delicious aromatics I have one
shallot just minced one carrot finely
grated so the carrot is going to add a
nice amount of flavor texture and
moisture as these little guys cook and I
have three tablespoons of crumbled feta
this will add a really nice rich Tang
enos sort of the janessa quoi of the
spur ger let's not forget salt 1tsp
coarse salt for more flavor and color
two tablespoons finely chopped parsley
this is already looking so lovely
vibrant colorful make sure everything's
nice and combined
now we're going to form this into a
tease and I always like to divide my
mixture in half so that I can eyeball it
a little bit better when I'm trying to
make my portions so I'm forming these
into six patties that would be great for
just a standard burger bun but what you
can also do with this recipe is you can
also form these
into slightly smaller Patties pan fry
them and serve them in toasted pita and
it makes a really nice sort of play on
falafel you could also cook them and add
them to salads if you are wanting to
stay away from carbohydrates
okay so burger patties are formed we're
going to let these hang out in the
fridge for about half an hour until they
firm up even more okay it's been 30
minutes my patties are nice and chilled
so let's get cooking
I have a heavy cast-iron pan this is
definitely my preferred skillet of
choice for this heating over medium heat
add about a tablespoon of olive oil so
the reason I love this heavy bottomed
pan is it gives you a really nice crispy
crust on the burgers so we'll add these
in batches and they'll cook for about
four minutes per side until they're
golden brown okay it's been about five
minutes and we're going to peek under
the patties see if they're nice and
golden beautiful let's give them a flip
looking great here so we'll cook them
for another four or five minutes on the
other side to get them nice and crisp so
let's check the burgers here it's been
about five minutes beautiful crispy
Brown so I'm just going to turn this
heat off and start assembling the bun so
I toasted these whole wheat buns with a
little bit of olive oil that makes them
really nice and crisp so let's spread it
with a little bit of mustard I have a
whole grain mustard here now we'll do a
little bit of fresh parsley leaves cuz
we had some already in our burger okay
let's get the main event on now this is
one of my favorite toppings for burgers
onions in any form I've grilled these on
a grill pan you can also caramelize them
they'd be delicious now always like
something a little fresh and crunchy on
my burger so I'm going to go with some
radicchio today this is a really nice
slightly bitter Italian lettuce so let's
close her up oh boy but this may require
a slice
so let's give this a try looks great mmm
super delicious satisfying meatless to
boot I can't wait for you to try it
